items.title: Basic Movement
content: Move up to your speed (typically 30 feet)
Can break up movement before and after actions
Moving while prone costs double movement

items.title: Climbing
items.content: Climbing costs extra movement (usually double). The DM might require a Strength (Athletics) check if the climb is difficult.

items.title: Swimming
items.content: Swimming costs extra movement (usually double). The DM might require a Strength (Athletics) check if the water is rough.

items.title: Jumping
items.content: Your long jump is equal to your Strength score in feet if you move at least 10 feet before jumping. Your high jump is equal to 3 + your Strength modifier in feet if you move at least 10 feet before jumping.

items.title: Tactical Positioning
items.content: Position yourself to gain cover (+2 to +5 AC), flank enemies (potential advantage), or protect allies. Smart positioning can be as valuable as a powerful attack.

items.title: Squeezing
items.content: You can squeeze through a space one size smaller than you. Doing so costs extra movement, and you have disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws.
